data.name: Sample - Fortinet FortiManager - 3.0.0
data.description: The Fortinet FortiManager provides easy centralized configuration, policy-based provisioning, update management and end-to-end network monitoring for your Fortinet installed environment.

workflows.name: Update Policy Package
workflows.description: Updates a policy package in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Create LDAP Server
workflows.description: Creates an LDAP server in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, LDAP server name, username, password, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Update Custom Service
workflows.description: Updates an existing custom service in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Delete Address Group
workflows.description: Deletes an address group from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type you have specified.

workflows.name: Delete Policy Package
workflows.description: Deletes a policy package from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Get Service Categories List
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of service categories or specific service categories from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other search parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiManager: Get Service Categories List

workflows.name: Create Address
workflows.description: Creates an address in Fortinet FortiManager based on the address name, level type, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Re-install Policy
workflows.description: Reinstalls a Firewall Policy in Fortinet FortiManager based on the ADOM Name and policy package name you have specified.

workflows.name: Global Level Block IP Address
workflows.description: Blocks IP addresses at the global level on Fortinet FortiGate based on the firewall header/footer policy, address group name, and other input parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiManager: Global Level Block IP Address

routes.name: Alerts -> Global Level Block IP Address

workflows.name: Get Events Related to Incident
workflows.description: Retrieves details of events associated with a Fortinet FortiManager incident, based on the incident ID and other input parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiManager: Get Events Related to Incident

routes.name: Alerts -> Get Events Related to Incident

workflows.name: Update Address Group
workflows.description: Updates an existing address group in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, method, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Delete Service Group
workflows.description: Deletes a service group from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type you have specified.

workflows.name: Update Service Group
workflows.description: Updates an existing service group in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, method, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Get Device List
workflows.description:
Retrieves a list of all devices or specific devices from Fortinet FortiManager based on the search parameters you have specified.
Note: If a parameter is left blank or null, then this operation will return devices matching all values.

workflows.name: Create Policy Package
workflows.description: Creates a policy package in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, package type, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: List ADOM Firewall Policies
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all ADOM firewall policies or specific ADOM firewall policies from Fortinet FortiManager based on the search parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiManager: List ADOM Firewall Policies

workflows.name: FortiManager > Ingest
workflows.description: This playbook demonstrate the list incident operation.

routes.name: Create Record -> Update Last Incident Pull Time

workflows.name: > FortiManager > Fetch
workflows.description: This playbook demonstrate the list incident operation.

arguments.category_mapping:
{
  "Unauthorized Access": "CAT1",
  "Denial of Service": "CAT2",
  "Malicious Code": "CAT3",
  "Improper Usage": "CAT4",
  "Scans/Probes/Attempted Access": "CAT5",
  "Uncategorized": "CAT6"
}

arguments.filter_query: {%set l1=[]%}{%if vars.search_query%}{%set temp= l1.append(vars.search_query)%}{%endif%}{%if vars.category%}{%set temp= l1.append('category='+vars.category_mapping[vars.category])%}{%endif%}{%if vars.severity%}{%set temp=l1.append('severity='+vars.severity_mapping[vars.severity])%}{%endif%}{%if vars.status%}{%set temp=l1.append('status='+vars.status_mapping[vars.status])%}{%endif%}{%if vars.last_pull_time%}{%set temp=l1.append('lastupdate>' + vars.last_pull_time | string + ' or createtime>' + vars.last_pull_time| string)%}{%endif%}{{l1 | join(' and ')}}

step_variables._configuration_schema:
[
  {
    "title": "Pull Incidents Created/Updated in Past X Minutes",
    "name": "minutes",
    "type": "text",
    "tooltip": "Pull the incidents created/updated in the past X minutes. e.g. 5",
    "required": true,
    "editable": true,
    "visible": true,
    "value": 5
  },
  {
    "title": "Search Query",
    "required": false,
    "editable": true,
    "visible": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "search_query",
    "tooltip": "Query in the format of field_name=\"field_value\" using which you want to filter incidents. For example incid=\"IN00000001\" and reporter=\"user1\"",
    "value": ""
  },
  {
    "title": "Category",
    "name": "category",
    "visible": true,
    "required": false,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "Unauthorized Access",
      "Denial of Service",
      "Malicious Code",
      "Improper Usage",
      "Scans/Probes/Attempted Access",
      "Uncategorized"
    ],
    "value": "Uncategorized",
    "description": "(Optional) The incident category. You can choose from the following options: Unauthorized access, Denial of Service, Malicious Code, Improper Usage, Scans/Probes/Attempted Access, or Uncategorized"
  },
  {
    "title": "Severity",
    "name": "severity",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "High",
      "Medium",
      "Low"
    ],
    "value": "Medium",
    "description": "(Optional) Specify incident severity level. You can choose from the following options: High, Medium, or Low."
  },
  {
    "title": "Status",
    "name": "status",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "New",
      "Analysis",
      "Response",
      "Closed: Remediated",
      "Closed: False Positive"
    ],
    "value": "New",
    "description": "(Optional) The incident status. You can choose from the following options: New, Analysis, Response, Closed: Remediated, or Closed: False Positive."
  }
]

steps.name: Create FortiManager Last Alert Pull Time Macro

routes.name: Create FortiManager Last Alert Pull Time Macro -> Set Time Configuration
Configuration -> Create Splunk Last Alert Pull Time Macro

workflows.description: Updates an LDAP server in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, LDAP server name, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all application names and associated details from the Fortinet FortiManager server.

workflows.description: Deletes an address from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type you have specified.

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all dynamic interfaces or specific dynamic interfaces from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other search parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Update User Group
workflows.description: Updates a user group in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, group name, change in the members' list, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Get Applications Control List
workflows.description: Retrieves a list all of application control profiles or specific application control profiles from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other search parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiManager: Get Applications Control List

workflows.name: List Incident
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all incidents or specific incidents from Fortinet FortiManager based on the search parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Create User Group
workflows.description: Creates a user group in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, group name, members list, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Update Incident
workflows.description: Update an incident in Fortinet FortiManager based on the incident ID and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Create Custom Service
workflows.description: Creates a custom service in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Update Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Updates a firewall policy in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, package type, policy package name, and other input parameters you have specified.

Alerts -> Copy  of Update Firewall Policy

workflows.name: >> FortiManager > Handle Macro
workflows.description: This playbook create FortiManager macro if not exists.

routes.name: Is Splunk Macro Exist -> Create Splunk Scheduler Macro
routes.label: No

routes.name: Fetch Macro Current Value -> No Operation
Is Splunk Macro Exist -> Fetch Macro Current Value
routes.label: Yes

workflows.name: Get Events
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all events or specific events from Fortinet FortiManager based on the search parameters you have specified.Note: If a parameter is left blank or null, then this operation will return events matching all values.

workflows.description: Installs a policy package on Fortinet FortiManager based on the ADOM, policy package name, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.description: Blocks applications on Fortinet FortiManager using the Application Control Profile Name you have specified. For more information see the "Blocking or Unblocking URLs, or applications in Fortinet FortiManager" section.

workflows.name: Unblock Application
workflows.description: Unblocks applications on Fortinet FortiManager using the Application Control Profile Name you have specified. For more information see the "Blocking or Unblocking URLs, or applications in Fortinet FortiManager" section.

workflows.description: Blocks URLs on Fortinet FortiManager using the Web Filter Profile Name you have specified.

workflows.description: Assigns a global policy package to ADOM packages in Fortinet FortiManager based on the policy package name, ADOM devices, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of URLs that are blocked on Fortinet FortiManager based on the specified web filter profile name, level type, and other search parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Unblock URL
workflows.description: Unblocks URLs on Fortinet FortiManager using the Web Filter Profile Name you have specified.

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of application names that are blocked on Fortinet FortiManager based on the specified application control name, level type, and other search parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Create Incident
workflows.description: Creates an incident in Fortinet FortiManager based on the reporter name, endpoint name, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Create Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Creates a firewall policy in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, package type, policy package name, and other input parameters you have specified.

Alerts -> Global Level Create Firewall Policy

workflows.name: Delete Custom Service
workflows.description: Deletes a custom service from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type you have specified.

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all user groups or specific user groups from Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type and other search parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Move Firewall Policy
workflows.description: Moves a firewall policy in Fortinet FortiManager based on the level type, policy ID, policy package name, target, and other input parameters you have specified.

routes.name: Alerts -> ADOM Level Move Firewall Policy

workflows.name: Get Event Details
workflows.description: Retrieves a list of event details (logs) from Fortinet FortiManager based on the alert IDs and other search parameters you have specified.
